name: Blume Ventures
description: Blume Ventures is one of India's leading early-stage venture capital firms, backing founders from pre-seed through seed stages. Founded in 2011, Blume has invested in over 150 startups across fintech, SaaS, and healthtech, with notable portfolio companies including Unacademy, Slice, and Grey Orange.

name: Kalaari Capital
description: Kalaari Capital is a leading early-stage technology-focused venture capital firm based in Bengaluru. Founded in 2006, Kalaari has invested in over 100 companies including Dream11, Myntra, and CureFit, focusing on consumer tech, SaaS, and healthtech sectors.

name: Nexus Venture Partners
description: Nexus Venture Partners is an early-stage venture capital firm investing across India and the US. With over $2 billion in assets under management, Nexus has backed category-defining companies like Delhivery, Postman, and Druva across fintech, enterprise, and SaaS verticals.

name: Accel India
description: Accel India is the Indian arm of global venture capital firm Accel, investing from seed through growth stages. With a portfolio including Flipkart, Swiggy, and Freshworks, Accel India is one of the most prolific investors in the Indian startup ecosystem, managing over $3 billion in assets.

name: Peak XV Partners
description: Peak XV Partners (formerly Sequoia Capital India & Southeast Asia) is one of the most prominent venture capital firms in India and Southeast Asia. Managing over $9 billion in assets, Peak XV has backed iconic companies like BYJU'S, Zomato, OYO, and Razorpay across consumer, fintech, and healthtech sectors.

name: 100X.VC
description: 100X.VC is India's first institutional investor to use iSAFE notes for pre-seed investments. Founded by Sanjay Mehta, 100X.VC invests in 20-25 startups per cohort across all sectors, making it one of the most active early-stage investors in India with a standardized $25K-$250K investment range.

name: Titan Capital
description: Titan Capital is an early-stage investment firm founded by Snapdeal co-founders Kunal Bahl and Rohit Bansal. Focused on pre-seed and seed stage companies, Titan Capital has backed over 200 startups across consumer and SaaS verticals with investments ranging from $100K to $1M.

name: India Quotient
description: India Quotient is a seed-stage venture capital fund focused on backing bold founders building uniquely Indian products. With investments in companies like ShareChat, Dunzo, and Sugar Cosmetics, India Quotient specializes in consumer and fintech startups targeting the Indian mass market.

name: Chiratae Ventures
description: Chiratae Ventures (formerly IDG Ventures India) is one of India's longest-standing venture capital firms, investing since 2006. With a focus on seed and Series A investments in SaaS, healthtech, and deeptech, Chiratae has backed companies like Myntra, Lenskart, and Firstcry.

name: Z47 (Matrix Partners India)
description: Z47, formerly Matrix Partners India, is a leading early-stage venture capital firm that has been investing in Indian startups since 2006. Known for backing companies like Ola, Razorpay, and OfBusiness, Z47 focuses on consumer, fintech, and SaaS with investments from seed to Series A.

name: Elevation Capital
description: Elevation Capital (formerly SAIF Partners India) is a premier venture capital firm investing across seed, Series A, and growth stages in India. With over $2 billion in cumulative capital raised, Elevation has backed companies like Paytm, Swiggy, Meesho, and ShareChat.

name: Lightspeed India
description: Lightspeed India is the Indian arm of Lightspeed Venture Partners, investing in seed and Series A stage companies. With a strong focus on SaaS, enterprise, and consumer technology, Lightspeed India has backed companies like Oyo, Udaan, and Sharechat with dedicated India-focused funds.

name: 3one4 Capital
description: 3one4 Capital is a Bengaluru-based venture capital firm investing in pre-seed through Series A startups. Founded by the Infosys co-founder's son Pranav Pai, 3one4 focuses on SaaS, deeptech, and fintech, with notable investments in Darwinbox, Licious, and Open Financial.

name: Stellaris Venture Partners
description: Stellaris Venture Partners is a seed and early-stage venture capital firm founded by former Helion Venture Partners team members. Investing in SaaS, consumer, and fintech startups across India, Stellaris has built a portfolio including Mamaearth, Ixigo, and Clovia.

name: Prime Venture Partners
description: Prime Venture Partners is an early-stage venture capital firm based in Bengaluru, investing in seed and Series A stage companies. Known for deep sector expertise in SaaS, healthtech, and fintech, Prime has backed companies like MyGate, NiYO Solutions, and Dozee.

name: WaterBridge Ventures
description: WaterBridge Ventures is a pre-seed and seed stage investment firm focused on consumer and enterprise startups in India. Founded by Manish Kheterpal, WaterBridge backs founders at the earliest stages across SaaS, fintech, and consumer verticals with check sizes ranging from $200K to $3M.

name: Venture Highway
description: Venture Highway is a pre-seed and seed stage venture capital firm based in Bengaluru. Founded by Samir Sood, a former Google executive, Venture Highway has backed companies like Meesho, Spinny, and Cred at their earliest stages, focusing on SaaS, consumer, and fintech startups.

name: Antler India
description: Antler India is the Indian arm of global early-stage VC and startup generator Antler. Operating a residency-based program, Antler India invests at the pre-seed stage across all sectors, helping founders build companies from the ground up with initial checks of $100K-$500K.

name: Better Capital
description: Better Capital is a pre-seed stage venture fund founded by Vaibhav Domkundwar, focused on backing first-time founders building SaaS, consumer, and fintech startups in India. With check sizes from $50K to $500K, Better Capital provides founder-first support with a strong community-driven approach.

name: Arkam Ventures
description: Arkam Ventures is a seed and early-stage venture capital firm investing in founders building for the next 500 million Indian consumers. Co-founded by former Flipkart executive Rahul Chari, Arkam focuses on fintech, healthtech, and logistics with deep expertise in India's mass market opportunity.

name: Y Combinator
description: Y Combinator is the world's most renowned startup accelerator, having funded over 4,000 companies including Airbnb, Stripe, Dropbox, and Razorpay. YC invests $500K in startups through its batch-based program, providing mentorship, network access, and follow-on funding opportunities.

name: Techstars
description: Techstars is a global startup accelerator network operating programs in over 150 countries. With investments of $120K per company, Techstars provides mentorship-driven acceleration and has backed over 4,000 startups across all sectors worldwide.

name: 500 Global
description: 500 Global (formerly 500 Startups) is a venture capital firm and accelerator with a global presence across 80+ countries. Known for its batch-based accelerator program, 500 Global invests $150K-$500K at pre-seed and seed stages across all sectors with a particularly strong presence in emerging markets.

name: Tiger Global
description: Tiger Global Management is a New York-based investment firm that has become one of the most prolific growth-stage investors globally. Known for rapid deal-making and large check sizes, Tiger Global has invested heavily in Indian startups including Flipkart, Ola, and Razorpay across consumer, fintech, and SaaS.

name: Insight Partners
description: Insight Partners is a global software and technology-focused venture capital and private equity firm managing over $80 billion in assets. Known for its ScaleUp program, Insight invests in high-growth SaaS and enterprise technology companies from Series A through growth stages.

name: General Catalyst
description: General Catalyst is a venture capital firm with over $25 billion in assets under management, investing from seed through growth stages. Active in India through partnerships, General Catalyst focuses on SaaS, fintech, and healthtech, with a philosophy of being responsible innovation partners.

name: Founders Fund
description: Founders Fund is a San Francisco-based venture capital firm founded by Peter Thiel, investing in revolutionary technology companies. Known for backing companies that push technological boundaries, Founders Fund invests across deeptech, consumer, and SaaS from seed to growth stages.

name: Andreessen Horowitz
description: Andreessen Horowitz (a16z) is one of Silicon Valley's most influential venture capital firms, managing over $35 billion across multiple funds. A16z invests across SaaS, fintech, AI/ML, and crypto, and has been increasingly active in India through its crypto and fintech-focused investments.

name: Lightspeed Venture Partners
description: Lightspeed Venture Partners is a global multi-stage venture capital firm with over $18 billion in AUM. Investing from seed through growth stages, Lightspeed has a strong global presence with dedicated India and Southeast Asia teams, backing companies like Snap, Affirm, and OYO.

name: Bessemer Venture Partners
description: Bessemer Venture Partners is one of the oldest venture capital firms in the US, founded in 1911, with over $20 billion in assets under management. Known for its Cloud 100 list, Bessemer has invested in companies like Shopify, Twilio, and Swiggy across SaaS, consumer, and healthcare sectors.

name: B Capital Group
description: B Capital Group is a multi-stage global venture capital firm co-founded by Eduardo Saverin (Facebook co-founder) and Raj Ganguly. With a focus on enterprise, fintech, and healthtech, B Capital bridges Silicon Valley innovation with emerging market opportunities, investing $5M-$50M per deal.

name: Ribbit Capital
description: Ribbit Capital is a fintech-focused venture capital firm that has become one of the most specialized and successful investors in financial technology globally. With investments in companies like Robinhood, Coinbase, and Razorpay, Ribbit invests from seed through growth across all fintech verticals.

name: QED Investors
description: QED Investors is a fintech-focused venture capital firm co-founded by Nigel Morris (Capital One co-founder). With deep domain expertise in financial services, QED invests globally in fintech companies from seed to Series A, with a portfolio including Credit Karma, Nubank, and Current.

name: Goodwater Capital
description: Goodwater Capital is a consumer technology-focused venture capital firm that uses proprietary data-driven analysis to identify and invest in breakout consumer companies. With investments in companies like StockX, Faire, and Cred, Goodwater targets seed and Series A stage consumer startups globally.

name: Surge (Peak XV)
description: Surge is the rapid scale-up program by Peak XV Partners (formerly Sequoia Capital India) designed for early-stage startups in India and Southeast Asia. Operating cohort-based programs, Surge invests $1M-$3M in pre-seed and seed stage companies across SaaS, consumer, and fintech verticals.

name: Indian Angel Network
description: Indian Angel Network (IAN) is one of India's largest and most active angel investor networks with over 500 members. Founded in 2006, IAN invests across all sectors at the pre-seed and seed stages, providing capital, mentorship, and strategic guidance to early-stage startups.

name: LetsVenture
description: LetsVenture is an Indian angel investing and syndicate platform connecting startups with angel investors and micro-VCs. The platform enables curated deal flow for investors and provides startups access to capital from $50K to $500K at pre-seed and seed stages across all sectors.

name: AngelList India
description: AngelList India is the Indian arm of the global AngelList platform, enabling angel investors to discover and invest in early-stage startups through syndicates and rolling funds. The platform facilitates investments from $25K to $500K at pre-seed and seed stages across all sectors.

name: Mumbai Angels
description: Mumbai Angels Network is one of India's premier angel investor networks, founded in 2006 with over 450 members across Mumbai, Delhi, Bengaluru, and other cities. The network invests $100K-$500K in pre-seed and seed stage startups across all sectors, providing mentorship alongside capital.

name: Calcutta Angels
description: Calcutta Angels is an angel investor network based in Kolkata, focused on backing early-stage startups across India. With investments ranging from $50K to $300K, Calcutta Angels provides pre-seed and seed capital along with mentorship from experienced entrepreneurs and business leaders.

name: T-Hub
description: T-Hub is India's largest technology incubator based in Hyderabad, established as a public-private partnership with the Government of Telangana. T-Hub provides incubation support, mentorship, and corporate innovation programs to pre-seed stage startups across all sectors without taking equity in most programs.

name: NASSCOM 10000 Startups
description: NASSCOM 10000 Startups is an ambitious initiative by India's technology industry body NASSCOM aimed at incubating, funding, and supporting 10,000 technology startups in India. The program provides incubation, mentorship, funding access, and industry connections to early-stage startups across all tech sectors.

name: Startup India
description: Startup India is a flagship initiative of the Government of India, launched in 2016 to build a strong ecosystem for nurturing innovation and startups. The program provides tax benefits, easier compliance, funding support through the Fund of Funds, and mentorship to recognized startups across all sectors.

name: Atal Innovation Mission
description: Atal Innovation Mission (AIM) is a flagship initiative by NITI Aayog, Government of India, to promote innovation and entrepreneurship across the country. AIM supports startups through Atal Incubation Centres, providing grants of up to $150K, mentorship, and infrastructure to early-stage ventures.

name: CIIE.CO (IIM Ahmedabad)
description: CIIE.CO is the innovation and incubation hub at IIM Ahmedabad, one of India's premier business schools. Through programs like Bharat Inclusion Initiative and CInI, CIIE.CO invests $50K-$500K in pre-seed and seed stage startups while providing deep incubation support and access to IIM Ahmedabad's network.

name: Omidyar Network India
description: Omidyar Network India is the India-focused arm of the impact investment firm established by eBay founder Pierre Omidyar. Investing in seed and Series A stage companies across fintech, edtech, and consumer sectors, Omidyar Network India focuses on ventures that create social impact at scale.

name: Sequoia Scout India
description: Sequoia Scout India (now under Peak XV Partners) is an angel investing program that enables select operators and founders to invest Peak XV's capital in pre-seed stage startups. Scouts invest $100K-$500K and provide startups with early access to the Peak XV ecosystem and follow-on funding.

name: Fireside Ventures
description: Fireside Ventures is India's first consumer brand-focused venture capital fund, investing in seed and Series A stage consumer and e-commerce startups. With a portfolio including Mamaearth, BoAt, and Yoga Bar, Fireside has established itself as the go-to investor for emerging consumer brands in India.

name: DST Global
description: DST Global is a global growth-stage investment firm founded by Yuri Milner, known for early investments in Facebook, Twitter, and Spotify. DST Global invests $50M-$500M in late-stage consumer and fintech companies, and has been active in India through investments in Swiggy, Ola, and Dream11.

name: SoftBank Vision Fund
description: SoftBank Vision Fund is one of the world's largest technology-focused investment funds, managing over $100 billion across two funds. Known for massive late-stage bets, SoftBank has invested heavily in Indian unicorns including Flipkart, Ola, Paytm, and Delhivery across consumer, fintech, and logistics.

name: Sequoia Capital
description: Sequoia Capital is one of the most storied venture capital firms in Silicon Valley, having backed Apple, Google, and WhatsApp. Managing over $85 billion, Sequoia invests from seed through growth in technology companies across SaaS, consumer, and enterprise.

name: Kleiner Perkins
description: Kleiner Perkins is a legendary Silicon Valley venture firm that backed Amazon, Google, and Twitter. Now focused on early-stage investments, KP invests in seed through Series B across SaaS, consumer, and healthtech.

name: Greylock Partners
description: Greylock Partners is a leading Silicon Valley venture capital firm known for investments in LinkedIn, Facebook, and Discord. Greylock invests primarily at seed and Series A stages in enterprise, consumer, and AI/ML companies.

name: Benchmark
description: Benchmark is an elite Silicon Valley venture firm famous for its equal partnership model and early bets on eBay, Twitter, Uber, and Snap. Benchmark invests exclusively at Series A with check sizes of $10-20M.

name: First Round Capital
description: First Round Capital is a premier US seed-stage venture firm that backs technology companies at the earliest stages. Known for investments in Uber, Square, and Notion, First Round offers a strong founder community and operational support.

name: Union Square Ventures
description: Union Square Ventures is a New York-based venture firm that has backed Twitter, Tumblr, Etsy, and Coinbase. USV focuses on seed and Series A investments in companies that broaden access to knowledge, capital, and wellbeing.

name: Atomico
description: Atomico is a leading European venture capital firm founded by Skype co-founder Niklas Zennstrom. Based in London, Atomico invests in seed through growth stage technology companies across Europe in SaaS, fintech, and deeptech.

name: Index Ventures
description: Index Ventures is a global venture capital firm with deep European roots, based in London and San Francisco. Known for backing Adyen, Deliveroo, Revolut, and Figma, Index invests from seed through growth in fintech, SaaS, and consumer companies.

name: Accel Europe
description: Accel Europe is the European arm of global VC firm Accel, based in London. Accel has been one of the most successful investors in European tech, backing Spotify, UiPath, CrowdStrike, and Deliveroo at early stages.

name: Balderton Capital
description: Balderton Capital is one of Europe's largest early-stage venture firms, based in London. Investing exclusively in European-founded companies from seed to Series B, Balderton has backed Revolut, Citymapper, and GoCardless.

name: Northzone
description: Northzone is one of Europe's most established venture capital firms, with offices in London, Stockholm, and New York. Known for being an early investor in Spotify, iZettle, and Trustpilot, Northzone invests from seed to Series B in consumer and SaaS companies across Europe.

name: Seedcamp
description: Seedcamp is Europe's leading pre-seed and seed venture fund, based in London. Having backed over 400 companies including TransferWise (Wise), UiPath, and Revolut, Seedcamp invests across all sectors at the earliest stages with check sizes of $100K-$500K.

name: STV
description: STV is the largest technology venture capital fund in the Middle East and North Africa, managing over $750 million. Based in Riyadh, STV invests in seed through growth stage companies across fintech, ecommerce, and enterprise technology in the MENA region.

name: BECO Capital
description: BECO Capital is a Dubai-based early-stage venture capital firm investing in technology startups across the Middle East and North Africa. Focused on seed and Series A, BECO backs fintech, ecommerce, and SaaS companies building for the MENA market.

name: Flat6Labs
description: Flat6Labs is the MENA region's leading seed and pre-seed stage startup program and fund. Operating accelerator programs across Abu Dhabi, Cairo, Riyadh, Bahrain, and Tunis, Flat6Labs has backed over 400 startups across all sectors in the Middle East and Africa.

name: Global Founders Capital
description: Global Founders Capital is a venture capital fund investing globally with a strong focus on emerging markets including the Middle East. GFC invests from pre-seed through Series A across ecommerce, fintech, and SaaS with a portfolio of over 300 companies.

name: Partech Africa
description: Partech Africa is the Africa-focused fund of global VC firm Partech, and one of the largest VC funds dedicated to African startups. Investing from seed to Series B, Partech Africa backs fintech, logistics, and healthtech companies across the continent.

name: TLcom Capital
description: TLcom Capital is a venture capital firm focused on technology companies in Sub-Saharan Africa. Managing the TIDE Africa Fund, TLcom invests from seed to Series B in fintech, enterprise, and logistics startups across Nigeria, Kenya, and the broader African continent.

name: Novastar Ventures
description: Novastar Ventures is an Africa-focused venture capital firm investing in early-stage companies that serve mass markets across East and West Africa. Focused on fintech, healthtech, and consumer sectors, Novastar backs seed and Series A startups with strong social impact potential.

name: Kaszek
description: Kaszek is the largest venture capital firm in Latin America, founded by MercadoLibre co-founders. Managing over $3 billion, Kaszek invests from seed to growth in fintech, ecommerce, and SaaS companies across Latin America.

name: Monashees
description: Monashees is one of Brazil's most prominent venture capital firms, investing in technology companies across Latin America since 2005. Focused on seed through growth stages, Monashees backs fintech, consumer, and SaaS startups with deep regional expertise.

name: ALLVP
description: ALLVP (AL Venture Partners) is a leading early-stage venture capital firm focused on Latin America, based in Mexico City. Investing at seed and Series A stages, ALLVP backs fintech, ecommerce, and SaaS startups across Mexico, Colombia, and Brazil.

name: Jungle Ventures
description: Jungle Ventures is a leading Southeast Asia-focused venture capital firm based in Singapore. Investing from seed through Series B, Jungle Ventures backs SaaS, fintech, and consumer companies across Southeast Asia and India.

name: East Ventures
description: East Ventures is one of Southeast Asia's most active early-stage venture capital firms, based in Jakarta and Singapore. Having invested in over 300 companies including Tokopedia, East Ventures focuses on pre-seed and seed stage startups across ecommerce, fintech, and SaaS.

name: Wavemaker Partners
description: Wavemaker Partners is a cross-border venture capital firm with offices in Singapore and Los Angeles, focused on enterprise and deeptech startups in Southeast Asia. Investing at seed and Series A stages, Wavemaker has backed over 200 companies across the region.
